resources.string: \u25CF Make sure there is only one golf ball in the frame
Set it up about one metre off the ground - around hip height. A tripod or attachment to your golf bag works well, or ask a friend to film you.
You\'ll be side on to your devices\'s camera, about four meters (or four paces) away. Make sure you have enough space to swing.
Take four strides from your camera (roughly four club lengths) and place the ball. Then come back to your device.
Adjust the alignment so that the ball is inside the box, and your device is level (using the guide lines for alignment). The record button will only work when the device is level.
You\'ll receive a countdown so you can set up before recording begins. You can select the length of the countdown (3 - 25 seconds) on the right of this screen.
